verse_translation.google_trans: who is this guardian in the strength of the strong;who looks like a lion and looks like a lion That is Bhishma, the Ketu of the Kuru dynasty;

verse_data: एतान्यनीकानि महानुभावं; गूहन्ति मेघा इव घर्मरश्मिम्
एतानि हत्वा पुरुषप्रवीर; काङ्क्षस्व युद्धं भरतर्षभेण

verse_translation.google_trans: These are the troops of the great man;They hide clouds like the heat ray killing these men, the hero of men;Desire for the battle with the best of the Bharatas
Dhritarashtra said

verse_data: उदग्रमनसः केऽत्र के वा दीना विचेतसः

verse_translation.google_trans: Whose delighted there the warriors fight Sanjaya Who are the poor who are fierce-minded?
who had previously struck the heart trembling there in battle Tell me, O Sanjaya, or of the Pandavas.
Whose army rises in the rising of fragrant flowers Words and circumambulations roared in the warriors
Sanjaya said
The warriors there were delighted with the two armies Fragrance of garlands, incense, drinks and fragrances.
O best of the Bharatas, the arrays of the compiled. There was a great debate of the slips of the slips

verse_data: कुञ्जराणां च नदतां सैन्यानां च प्रहृष्यताम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The sound of musical instruments is tumultuous and mixed with conches and drums Let the elephants and the troops rejoice
Dhritarashtra said
They were assembled in the field of Dharma and Kurukshetra What did my Pandavas do Sanjaya
Sanjaya said
Seeing the army of the Pandavas arrayed, Duryodhana then The king approached the teacher and spoke the words
Behold this great army of the sons of Pandu Armed with the wise son of Drupada, your disciple
Here, the brave men, the great archer, equal to Bhima and Arjuna. Yuyudhana Virata and Drupada and the great charioteer
Dhrishtaketu Chekitana and the mighty king of Kasi Purujit Kuntibhoja and Shaibya and Naraprabhuva
Yudhamanyu and Vikranta and Uttamauja were mighty Saubhadra and Draupadi were all great charioteers

verse_data: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम
नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते

verse_translation.google_trans: But listen to those who are distinct from us, O Blessed One The heroes of my army I tell you
You are Bhishma, Karna and Kripa and Samitinjaya Ashvatthama, Vikarna and Saumadatti and so on

verse_data: अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः

verse_translation.google_trans: And many other brave men have given up their lives for my sake They were all warfare and expert in various weapons
Insufficient that our strength is protected by Bhishma This is enough of these strengths protected by Bhima
and in all the ayana in their proper places May you all protect Bhishma alone
The grandfather of the Kurus, the old Kuru, gave birth to him. The glorious one blew the sound of the lion's roar loudly
Then the conches and the drums and the panavankagomukha Suddenly they were attacked and the sound became tumultuous
Then they stood in a great chariot with white horses Madhava and Pandava also blew the divine conches
Panchajanya, Hrishikesha, Devadatta, Dhananjaya. Paundra blew the great conchshell Bhimakarma Vrikodara
King Yudhisthira, the son of Kunti, the victory of Infinite Nakula and Sahadeva and Sughoshamanipushpaka
Kasya and the supreme archer and Shikhandi the great charioteer Dhrishtadyumna, Virata, Satyaki and Aparajita
Drupada and Draupadi, O lord of the earth, all over Saubhadra and the mighty-armed one blew their conches separately
That cry pierced the hearts of the Dhritarashtra The sky and the earth were tumultuous and resounded
Then, seeing the Dhritarashtra's army standing, the monkey flag The Pandavas raised their bow in the company of weapons.
Then he said these words to Hrishikesh, O king. Place the chariot between the two armies and the Acyuta
Until I look at these, I’m not going to fight. I have to fight with Carma in this battlefield
I look at the fighters who have gathered here They wanted to please the evil-minded Dhritarashtra
Thus spoken, Hrishikesha, by Gudakesha, India Place the best of the chariots between the two armies
Bhishma and Drona in the forefront and all the kings of the earth He said, O Partha, look at these assemblies.
There he saw the fathers and grandfathers standing there teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons and friends
Fathers-in-law and friends and both the armies Seeing them, Kaunteya, all his relatives standing there.
He was overwhelmed with compassion and said this. Seeing these relatives, Krishna, who are equally present.

verse_data: सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: My limbs are aching and the mouth is dry Trembling and my body are thrilled in my hair

verse_data: न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः

verse_translation.google_trans: The skin is slipped and the skin is burned and the skin is burned. I can't stand it and my mind seems to be wandering about
I see the occasions and the opposite, Keshav I do not see any good in killing my own people in battle

verse_data: न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च
किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा

verse_translation.google_trans: I do not desire victory, O Krishna, nor kingdom and pleasures What is our kingdom, O Govinda, or by pleasures?

verse_data: येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च
त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च

verse_translation.google_trans: For whose sake we have desired kingdom, pleasures and pleasures They are these who are present in battle and give up their lives and wealth
Teachers, fathers, sons and grandfathers Maternal uncles, father-in-laws, grandchildren and synclosers.

verse_data: अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते

verse_translation.google_trans: I don’t want to kill these, even if you kill, Madhusoodana Even for the sake of the kingdom of the three worlds, what about the earth
What pleasure can we have killed Dhritarashtra, O Janardana He takes refuge in sin and kills them and terrorates them

verse_data: स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव

verse_translation.google_trans: Therefore we should not kill Dhritarashtra and Sabandhavan For how can we be happy after killing our own people, Madhava
Although these do not see, their minds are overwhelmed by greed The fault of destroying the family and the sin of betraying a friend
How can we not know how to turn away from sin Janardana by those who see the fault in the destruction of the family
The eternal family religions are destroyed at the end of the family When righteousness is lost, the whole family overcomes irreligion.
O Krishna, the women of the family are polluted by the attack of iniquity O Varshney, a hybrid of castes is born in evil women
Sankaro is for the sake of hell and of the family killers The fathers fall into their lost bodies and water.
By these faults, the hybrids of the clan-killers. The caste systems and the family religions are destroyed eternal
Janardana of human beings who have destroyed family religions I have heard that he becomes a fixed dwelling in hell

verse_data: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Oh, we’ve decided to commit a great sin They were ready to kill their relatives with greed for the pleasures of the kingdom
If I resist me with weapons and armed with weapons The Dhritarashtras will kill him in battle, and that will be better for me.
Having said this, Arjuna sat down in the battlefield in battle. Leaving his bow with his arrows, his mind was overwhelmed with grief.
Sanjaya said
He was so overwhelmed with compassion and eyes full of tears Madhusoodana spoke these words in despair
Sri Bhagavanvacha
Where did you come from this trouble in the odd Anaryajushtamasvargyamakirtikaramarjuna

verse_data: क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: Don't go to the fatigue, O Partha, this does not apply to you Leave the weakness of the petty heart and get up, O Parantapa
Arjuna said

verse_data: कथं भीष्ममहं संख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन

verse_translation.google_trans: How am I Bhishma and Drona in battle, Madhusoodana I will fight with arrows, O destroyer of the worshipful.

verse_data: गुरूनहत्वा हि महानुभावा;ञ्श्रेयो भोक्तुं भैक्षमपीह लोके

verse_translation.google_trans: For the greatest of the great men who have killed the teacher; kill the desires and desires, but the teachers are here;Eating the pleasures of blood.

verse_data: न चैतद्विद्मः कतरन्नो गरीयो; यद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयुः
यानेव हत्वा न जिजीविषाम;स्तेऽवस्थिताः प्रमुखे धार्तराष्ट्राः

verse_translation.google_trans: And we don’t know where the greater;Whether we conquer or whether they conquer us The Dhritarashtras are situated in the foremost of those who do not want to kill.

verse_data: यच्छ्रेयः स्यान्निश्चितं ब्रूहि तन्मे; शिष्यस्तेऽहं शाधि मां त्वां प्रपन्नम्

verse_translation.google_trans: the nature of the defects of carnality;I ask you, the mind-confused minds. Tell me what is better than what is better;I am your disciple, instruct me, I have surrendered to you.
I do not see my removal; Avapya bhumavasapatnamriddham;The kingdom is also the rule of the gods
Sanjaya said

verse_data: न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह

verse_translation.google_trans: Having said this, the tormentor of the gudakesh to Hrishikesh He said to Govinda that he would not fight and became silent.
Hrishikesh said to him, laughing, India This word is depressed between the two armies
Sri Bhagavanvacha
You have regrets the unrepentant and speak the words of wisdom. The wise do not regret the past and the dead

verse_data: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः
न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I have never been, nor are you, nor are these people. Nor will we all be thereafter.
In this body, as in the body, youth is old age and old age. and the patient is not deluded there
The touches of the senses, O Kaunteya, are cold and heat, pleasure and pain. Bearing them, O India, for the arrival of the Agama and the Agama.

verse_data: यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ

verse_translation.google_trans: For whom these do not afflict the man, O bull. He is steadfast in equal suffering and pleasure for immortality

verse_data: नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः

verse_translation.google_trans: There is no being in the unreal, and there is no absence of the real. Both have seen the end of these two truths

verse_data: अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्

verse_translation.google_trans: But know that indestructible, by which all this is pervaded. No one can destroy this inexhaustible
These bodies are the ends of the eternal body. Indestructible and immeasurable, therefore fight, India.

verse_data: य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम्
उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: He who knows him is a murderer and he who thinks it is killed Both of them are not known, neither kills nor is killed.

verse_data: न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचि;न्नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः
अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो; न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे

verse_translation.google_trans: He is never born or dies; This is the unborn, eternal, eternal, ancient;It is not killed in the body being killed

verse_data: कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The Vedas are indestructible and eternal who is unborn and inexhaustible How does that man, Partha, kill whom and kills whom?

verse_data: वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय; नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि
तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णा;न्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही

verse_translation.google_trans: as leaving behind the old clothes;A man takes new others and leaving the bodies, leaving the body;

verse_data: नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः
न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः

verse_translation.google_trans: Weapons do not cut him, nor does fire burn him. It is not wetted by water nor dried by the wind
This is cut, burned, wetted and dry. This is eternal, omnipresent, stable and immovable, eternal.
This is the unmanifest, this is the unthinkable, this is called the incorruptible. Therefore, knowing this, you should not regret him.

verse_data: अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Then you think that he is eternally born or eternally dead Nevertheless, O mighty-armed one, you should not grieve for him

verse_data: जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च

verse_translation.google_trans: For death is certain for the born and birth is certain for the dead Therefore, you should not grieve for the inevitable.
The unmanifest and other beings are manifested in the middle of India The unmanifest deaths are the regrets there

verse_data: आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः शृणोति; श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित्

verse_translation.google_trans: Someone looks at him as a wonder; And as a wonder, another hears it;Even after hearing it, no one knows it
The body is eternally immortal in the body of all India Therefore you should not grieve for all beings
You should not be shaken by your own religion There is nothing better for a Kshatriya than righteousness and warfare
The gateway to heaven was covered by chance The happy Kshatriyas, Partha, attain such a battle.

verse_data: अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं संग्रामं न करिष्यसि
ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि

verse_translation.google_trans: Then if you will not fight this righteous battle Then you will give up your religion and fame and incur sin
They will tell you the infamy of being infamy and the fame of the probable is exceeded from death

verse_data: येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The great charioteers will think you will follow you out of fear And of whom you will go lightly and go to the light

verse_data: निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम्

verse_translation.google_trans: And they will speak many inexpressible arguments. They condemn your power and then more painful

verse_data: हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Whether you are killed or you will get heaven or you will conquer the earth Therefore, O Kaunteya, arise, determined to fight.
Happiness and pain are equal in profit and loss, victory and defeat Then engage in battle and you will not incur such a sin

verse_data: एषा तेऽभिहिता सांख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु
बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि

verse_translation.google_trans: This is the intelligence of Sankhya, which is described to you, and listen to this in Yoga. With intelligence, O Partha, you will abandon the bondage of action.
There is no destruction of transgression here and there is no retribution Even a little of this religion saves from great fear
Occupational intelligence, Kurunandana There are many branches and infinite intelligences of the incomprehensible
The wise speak this flowering word They are engaged in the arguments of the Vedas, O Partha, and there is no other.
The lustful souls are the fruits of birth and death. To the movement of pleasure and wealth, multiplied by the special actions
They are attached to pleasure and wealth and are taken away by it Business intelligence is not prescribed in samadhi
The Vedas about the Trinity are free from the three modes of nature, O Arjuna. He is free from duality and eternal in the eternal Sattva, the safety of the safety.
as long as in the waters of the waters of the flooded water everywhere Tavan in all the Vedas, knowing the Brahmin.
Karmanyevadhikaraste ma phaleshu kadachan Let not the fruits of action be your cause, nor let your attachment be to inaction.

verse_data: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनंजय
सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: Do your actions in yoga, leaving association, Dhananjaya Being equal to perfection and incompleteness is called yoga
Doorena hyavaram karma buddhiyogadhanjaya Relate in intelligence, for the sake of the miserable.
Intelligently, both good and evil deeds are here. Therefore, engage yoga for yoga, skill in actions.

verse_data: कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः

verse_translation.google_trans: For the wise abandon the fruits of their actions and the wise Freed from the bondage of birth, they go to the stage of health.

verse_data: तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च

verse_translation.google_trans: When your intelligence will cross the ocean of delusion Then you will go to detachment from what you have to hear and what you have heard
When they are contrary to the Scriptures, they will remain motionless Samadhavachala buddhi then you will attain yoga
Arjuna said

verse_data: स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम्

verse_translation.google_trans: What is the language of the steady-minded, Keshav of Samadhi. What does the steady mind speak, what will he sit, what does he go?
Sri Bhagavanvacha
When he gives up all desires, O Partha, the mind is in the mind Satisfied with the Self in the Self, the steady-wise is then called.
The mind is not anxious in suffering and is devoid of desire for pleasures He is called a sage who is free from attachment, fear and anger.

verse_data: नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता

verse_translation.google_trans: He who is not attached everywhere, having attained it, good and evil. He neither rejoices nor hates his wisdom is established
When this tortoise withdraws like limbs in all directions The senses are established by his senses and his wisdom is established
The objects of the body are ceased The avoidance of taste is also reversed by seeing the other.
Even though he tries, O son of Kaunteya, the wise man of the man The senses are the ones who take away the mind forcibly

verse_data: तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः
वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता

verse_translation.google_trans: He should restrain all of them and be steadfast and devoted to Me For he who has the senses under his control has established wisdom
When a man meditates on objects, association with them arises. From attachment lust is born of lust and anger is born of lust
Anger causes delusion and delusion is the delusion of memory Destruction of intelligence from the loss of memory is destroyed by the destruction of intelligence
But by those who are devoid of passion and hatred, objects and senses. The self-control attains grace by the self-control
In grace, all suffering is lost. For the intellect of a happy mind is quick
There is no intelligence of the unjust nor the sense of the righteous And where happiness is there happiness for the unsettled when he meditates on
For the mind is followed by the movements of the senses That takes away his wisdom as the wind in the boat in the water
Therefore, O mighty-armed one, all of them are restrained in all respects The senses are established by his senses and his wisdom is established

verse_data: या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी
यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः

verse_translation.google_trans: The night in which all beings are awake in the restraint The night in which the beings are awake is the night of the sage.

verse_data: तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे; स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी

verse_translation.google_trans: Apurmanamachalapratishtham;As the waters of the sea enter Similarly, the desires of whom all enter;He attains peace, not lustful.
Leaving all other desires, a man walks without desire He who is devoid of love and egoism attains peace

verse_data: एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: This is the Brahmic state, O Partha, and one who has attained it is not deluded. Standing in this time, he attains Brahmanirvana even at the end of time
Arjuna said

verse_data: तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव

verse_translation.google_trans: If you are superior to your actions, you are considered to be the intelligence of Janardana So why are you employing me in a terrible action, Keshav
You seem to be bewitching my intelligence with your confused words Tell me one thing that I am sure that I will get the best.
Sri Bhagavanvacha
In this world there are two kinds of fidelity, O sinless one. By the yoga of knowledge of the Sankhyas, by the Yoga of Karma.
A man does not attain to inaction by not performing actions Nor does he attain perfection by renunciation
No one ever stays for a moment and does not do anything For all action is done by the qualities born of nature.

verse_data: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन्

verse_translation.google_trans: He who restrains the senses of action and remembers with his mind He who is deluded by sense objects is called a false conductor
He who begins to control the senses by the mind, O Arjuna. He who is unattached to the senses of action and the yoga of action is distinguished

verse_data: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः

verse_translation.google_trans: Do the determined action, for action is better than inaction. And even the journey of the body is not known to the action
This world is bound by action other than action for the sake of sacrifice For that purpose, O Kaunteya, the free association should perform the action.
Creating the co-sacrifices and the creatures, the Creator said before. By this you will bear children, and this is your wishful thinking.
By the feeling of the gods, let them feel you, O gods. You will attain the highest good by feeling for each other

verse_data: तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः

verse_translation.google_trans: For the gods will give you the desired enjoyments, for they are devoted to the sacrifice He who eats from those who have given and not given to him is a thief

verse_data: भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात्

verse_translation.google_trans: The saints who eat the remains of the sacrifice are freed from all sins They eat the sin of those who cook for their own sake
From food come beings, and from rain food is possible. From sacrifice comes the rain, the sacrifice is the source of action.
Know that karma is the origin of the Brahman, the origin of the Brahma-akshara. Therefore the omnipresent Brahman is always established in the sacrifice
He who does not follow the cycle thus introduced here He lives in vain, O Partha, infallible in the sense of innocentness.

verse_data: आत्मन्येव च संतुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: A man who is self-satisfied and self-satisfied And satisfied in himself, there is no work for him
No one here has the meaning of what he has done. He has no dependence on any meaning in all beings
Therefore, unattached, constantly perform the work of action. The unattached man who does the action attains the Supreme Personality of Godhead
For by action alone the Janakas and others are established You should do the collection of folk collections.
Whatever the best does, that is what the other person does. The world follows what he proves

verse_data: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किंचन

verse_translation.google_trans: I have nothing to do in the three worlds, Partha It is not to be attained and to be attained and to be present in action

verse_data: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः

verse_translation.google_trans: If I never behave lazily in action Men follow my path, O Partha.

verse_data: उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम्

verse_translation.google_trans: These worlds would perish if I did not do the action I shall be the doer of hybridization and kill these people
As they are attached to action, they do as they do, India. The learned should do so attached to the collection of the worlds.
It should not cause differences of intelligence to the ignorant ones who are attached to action He should engage all his actions, learned and engaged.
The actions of nature are all actions in all respects The ego-delusional soul thinks that I am the doer

verse_data: गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते

verse_translation.google_trans: Tattvavittu mahabaho gunakarmavibhagayoh He does not attach himself to the modes of nature.
They are deluded by the modes of nature and are attached to the modes of nature Tankrutsnavido slow the whole of the slaughter should be moved.
Renouncing all actions in Me with the mind of the spiritual master Fight without hope and free from fever.
Those human beings who always follow this opinion of mine They are also freed from the faithful and are not jealous.
Those who are jealous of this do not follow my opinion Know them to be deluded by all knowledge and lost consciousness.

verse_data: प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: Even the wise man acts like his own nature Beings go to nature and what will restraint do
The sense of the senses is arranged for passion and hatred for the sake of the senses They do not come under the control of the two, and his opponents are his opponents
Better is self-religion, devoid of virtue, from the religion of others. Death in one's own religion is better than the religion of others, fearful.
Arjuna said

verse_data: अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः

verse_translation.google_trans: Then by whom is this sin committing a man Even though he did not want to, Varshney was employed as a force.
Sri Bhagavanvacha
Desire is anger This is the origin of the modes of passion Mahashano mahapapma viddhyyenaha virinam
Fire is covered with smoke as a mirror and dirt As the pregnancy is covered by the ulbey, so is this covered with it
The knowledge of the eternal enemy of the wise is covered by this In the form of desire, O Kaunteya, and by the fire of the evil fire.
The senses are the mind and the intellect is called the position of this By these he bewilders the embodied by covering knowledge
Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, you have controlled the senses in the beginning Prapman prajahi idenam jnana jnanashanam

verse_data: मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः

verse_translation.google_trans: They say that the senses are beyond the senses. The mind is the supreme intellect which is beyond the intellect.
Thus, understanding beyond the intellect, he restrained himself by himself. Kill the enemy, O mighty-armed one, in the form of desire, which is difficult to overcome.
Sri Bhagavanvacha
I have said this yoga in the Vivasvanya, the inexhaustible Vivasvan said to Manu, Manu said to the Ikshvaka.

verse_data: स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परंतप

verse_translation.google_trans: Thus the Rajarshis know this traditional That is the great yoga of the great time here, O Parantapa.

verse_data: स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः
भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम्

verse_translation.google_trans: That is the same ancient yoga I have told you today This is the best secret that you are my devotee and friend
Arjuna said

verse_data: अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः

verse_translation.google_trans: Another birth of your birth is the next birth of Vivasvata How can I know this in the beginning?
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन
तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परंतप

verse_translation.google_trans: Many births have passed by me, O Arjuna I know all of them, but you don't know, O Parantapa
Even though he is unborn and inexhaustible, he is also the Lord of all beings I am able to do my own nature by my own illusory power

verse_data: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत

verse_translation.google_trans: Whenever there is a loss of religion, India I create the rise of irreligion and that self.
To save the righteous and to destroy the wicked I am able to establish religion in every age

verse_data: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः
त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन

verse_translation.google_trans: My birth and action are divine and thus he who knows in truth Leaving the body, he does not reborn, he says, O Arjuna.
They are free from attachment, fear and anger, and they have taken refuge in Me. Many, purified by the austerities of knowledge, have come to me.

verse_data: ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I worship those who worship Me in the same way Men follow my path, O Partha.

verse_data: काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः
क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा

verse_translation.google_trans: Desiring the perfection of actions, the gods here offer sacrifices For quickly in the human world, perfection is born of karma
I have created the four varnas by the divisions of the modes of nature Even the doer of it know Me, the inexhaustible doer.

verse_data: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा
इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: I do not smear my actions, nor do I desire the fruits of my actions. Thus he who knows Me is not bound by actions

verse_data: एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः
कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Thus knowing the action performed by the ancients who desire liberation Do the action itself, therefore you have done the past before.
Even the poets are deluded here as to what is action and what is action I will tell you that action, knowing that you will be freed from evil.

verse_data: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः

verse_translation.google_trans: For action should also be understood and should be understood by the inaction and the inaction is to be understood as the deep movement of action.

verse_data: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः

verse_translation.google_trans: He who sees inaction and action in action. He is wise in men, he is righteous and performs all his actions.
whose all undertakings are devoid of lust and resolution The wise call him a wise man who has burnt the fire of knowledge of knowledge
Leaving behind the attachment of the fruits of action, he is ever satisfied and devoid of dependence He does nothing even when he is engaged in action
Disappointed and mindful of the self-realized Doing the physical action only does not get sin

verse_data: समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: He is satisfied with the gain of chance and is free from envy. He is equal to perfection and incompleteness and is not bound even by doing it
The mind of the liberated one who is free from attachment The whole of the action of the performer of the sacrifice is dissolved
Brahma-arpana is offered by Brahma in the Brahma-agni Brahma. Brahma is the one who should go to the Brahma-karma-samadhi
Others worship the sacrifice of fate. Brahmagnavapare yajnam yajnenaiva upjuhti
Other senses, such as the ear, offer sacrifices in the fires of restraint. They offer sounds and other objects in the fires of other senses.
All the senses are the actions of life and others The self-control in the fire of the yoga of self-restraint is the light of knowledge
Material sacrifices, austerities, yoga sacrifices and others. The ascetics of self-study, knowledge and sacrifices are restrained vows.
Apane juhti pranam prane apanam tathapare Pranapanagati blocking the pranayama.
Others are regularly eating their lives in the souls All these are the knowers of sacrifices and the sins of the sacrifice
The sacrifice remains nectar-eater go to the eternal Brahman. There is no world for the sacrifice, where else, O best of the Kurus, is there.

verse_data: एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे

verse_translation.google_trans: Thus there are many kinds of sacrifices spread in the mouth of the Brahman Know all of them to be born of action and you will be liberated in this way
The sacrifice of knowledge is better than the good matter, but the sacrifice of knowledge. All actions are completed in knowledge, O Partha.
Know that by bowing down and by serving the question They will teach you knowledge, the wise, the truth-seekers.
Knowing that, you will not go again, O Pandava. By which you will see the rest of beings in yourself and in Me
Even if you are the most sinful of all sins You will cross all troubles by the float of knowledge
As the fire burns the fuel from the ashes, O Arjuna. The fire of knowledge burns all actions to ashes

verse_data: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: For there is nothing holy here like knowledge That self-perfected yoga finds himself in himself in time
The faithful attains knowledge, the devotee of the self, the self-controlled. He soon attains supreme peace and attains supreme peace

verse_data: नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः

verse_translation.google_trans: The ignorant and the faithful are destroyed by doubt There is no world, no other, no happiness for the doubting soul.
Yoga-sannyastakarmanaam jnana-sanna-sanshayam They do not bind the self-possessed, Dhananjaya
Therefore, the heart is the source of the knowledge of the soul. Cut this doubt and practice yoga, O India.
Arjuna said

verse_data: संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि

verse_translation.google_trans: Renunciation of actions, O Krishna, and re-yoga of actions. Tell me certainly what is better than one of these two
Sri Bhagavanvacha
Sannyasa and Karma Yoga are both Nisreyaskara and both But the yoga of action is superior to the renunciation of action

verse_data: ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति

verse_translation.google_trans: The knowable is the eternal renunciate who does not hate or desire For he is free from duality, O mighty-armed one, and is freed from bondage from bondage
Children speak separately in Sankhya Yoga and not the wise He who stands in one of the rights finds the fruit of both.

verse_data: एकं सांख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: The place which is attained by the numbers is also attained by yoga He who sees one Sankhya and Yoga sees
Sannyasa, O mighty-armed one, is the source of suffering. A sage who is engaged in yoga soon attains Brahman
Yoga-connected, pure-minded, conquered-minded and self-controlled. The Self-being of all beings is not tainted even while doing
The truthful one should think that I am not doing anything Seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, walking, breathing, breathing.
Pralapan, leaving, grabbing, and blossoming. Holding that the senses are present in the sense objects.

verse_data: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः

verse_translation.google_trans: He who does his actions without association with the Brahman. He is not stained by sin like a lotus leaf with water
By body, mind and intelligence, even by the senses alone. The yogis perform action for the purpose of self-purification
The righteous abandons the fruits of his actions and attains peace of peace The unjust is bound by the lustful fruit.

verse_data: नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन्

verse_translation.google_trans: Renouncing all actions in the mind, you are subdued by happiness. The body is not doing the new gate in the city.

verse_data: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः

verse_translation.google_trans: The Lord creates no doership, no actions of the world. Not the combination of the fruits of action, but the nature of nature.

verse_data: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः

verse_translation.google_trans: The Lord does not take any sin for anyone nor does the Lord Knowledge covered by ignorance is deluded by animals
But by knowledge that ignorance of those whose soul is destroyed Their knowledge illuminates their knowledge as the sun.
That intellects, that self, are devoted to it, and devoted to it. They go to the repetition of knowledge and are cleansed of their sins

verse_data: शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः

verse_translation.google_trans: In a Brahmin who is endowed with knowledge and humility, he is a cow of a cow. The wise are equally seen in the dog and in the dog-eater

verse_data: इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः
निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद्ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः

verse_translation.google_trans: Here is the creation conquered by those whose mind is in equality For the innocent is equal Brahman, therefore they are situated in the Brahman.
He should not rejoice when he receives what is pleasant and should not be angry when he receives unpleasant things Stepsed and unconfused, Brahma-knowing is situated in the Brahman.
The soul attached to external touches finds happiness in the self He who is endowed with the Brahma Yoga attains inexhaustible happiness

verse_data: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते
आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः

verse_translation.google_trans: For those pleasures born of touch are the sources of suffering. Mercury does not rejoice in them, O Kaunteya, who have the beginning and the end.

verse_data: कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः

verse_translation.google_trans: He who can endure here from the liberation of the previous body He who is endowed with the speed arising from lust and anger is a happy man
He who is inner happiness and inner comfort and who is inner light That yogi attains Brahmanirvana, the Brahman-being.
The sages attain Brahmanirvana, the depleted impurities. They are cut off and self-controlled and engaged in the welfare of all beings
They were devoid of lust and anger and were controlled by the ascetics There is Brahmanirvana around the known souls
Touching the outside and the external eyes in the middle of the eyebrows The breathing and exhaling are equally moving within the nose

verse_data: विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः

verse_translation.google_trans: The sage, the mind and the intellect, the devotee of liberation. He who is always free from desire, fear and anger is always liberated
The enjoyer of sacrifices and austerities, the Lord of all the worlds. Knowing Me as the friend of all beings he attains peace
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः
स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः

verse_translation.google_trans: He who does action without dependence on the fruit of action. He is a renunciate and a yogi and not a fire and not active

verse_data: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव

verse_translation.google_trans: Know that yoga which is called renunciation, O Pandava No one becomes a yogi without renouncing resolve
The yoga of the sage who desires to ascend is called the cause of action The same peacefulness of the yoga-rise is called the cause
For when he is not attached to the sense objects and not to action The renunciant of all resolutions is called yoga.
He should lift himself up and not despise himself The self is the friend of the self and the self is the enemy of the self.
The friend of the self is the self by which the self is conquered by the self But in the enmity of the non-self, the self is like the enemy.
The Supreme Self is concentrated on the conquered soul and the peaceful in cold and heat, pleasure and pain, and in honor and dishonour.
He is satisfied with knowledge and science and has conquered the senses of the Kutastha The yogi is called yukta, equal to closer, stone and gold
Friends, friends, indifferents, hatred and relatives and even in the saintly sins, equal intelligence is preferable
The yogi should always engage himself in secret The solitary self-control is a hopeless marriage
Establish in a clean place and a steady seat for himself Not too high, not too low, Chaila, deerskin and kusha.
There, with a concentrated mind, the mind and senses are controlled. Sitting down in the seat, one should practice yoga for self-purification
Holding the body, head and neck equally steady. Looking at the tip of the nose and looking at his directions

verse_data: मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः

verse_translation.google_trans: Standing in the vow of celibacy without fear of peaceful soul The mind should be controlled and the mind should be steadfast and devoted to Me
The yogi who thus engages the eternal soul with a fixed mind He attains peace, the supreme state of Nirvana.
There is no yoga for one who eats too much, nor does he eat alone. Nor is it a very dreamy, nor is he awake, O Arjuna.
In the actions of the righteous eater and the monastery The yoga of the right dream understanding is the destroyer of suffering
When the humble mind remains in the Self It is said that he is free from desire and is endowed with all desires

verse_data: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता

verse_translation.google_trans: as the lamp is in the wind, nor is it remembered as a metaphor. The yogi who has controlled his mind is engaged in the yoga of the self
Yatroparamate chittam niruddham yogasevaya Wherever he sees himself in himself he is satisfied with himself

verse_data: वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः

verse_translation.google_trans: Happiness is the ultimate, the sense-perceivable is the transcendental. He knows where he is and does not move in fact

verse_data: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः

verse_translation.google_trans: which he who has obtained and thinks of another benefit is not more than then in which he is not moved by the Guru and is not moved by suffering
That is known as the separation of pain and separation. That yoga should be practiced with determination with an undisturbed mind
Leaving all desires arising from resolutions, all of them are allowed. By the mind itself, regulating the grammatical village all around.

verse_data: आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किंचिदपि चिन्तयेत्

verse_translation.google_trans: Slowly, slowly ceases, with intelligence, patience, captured With the mind fixed on the self, one should not think of anything
Wherever the mind moves, it is restless and unsteady Then and then regulate this and bring it under control of himself
This is the best happiness for the yogi with a calm mind approaches the tranquil dust, the Brahman-being, the immaculate.
The yogi who thus engages himself in this way is free from impurities Happiness enjoys the supreme happiness by the touch of the Brahman
In all beings, the Self and all beings in the Self. The yogic soul looks at the equal vision everywhere

verse_data: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति
तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: He who sees me everywhere and sees everything in me I am not destroyed by him and he is not destroyed by me

verse_data: सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते

verse_translation.google_trans: He who worships Me in all beings and is situated in oneness Even though he is present in every way, that yogi is in me

verse_data: सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः

verse_translation.google_trans: He who sees equal everywhere by self-likeness, O Arjuna Whether it is happiness or pain, that yogi is considered to be the supreme.
Arjuna said
This is the yoga you have mentioned in equality, Madhusoodana I do not see this stable state because it is restless because of its restlessness

verse_data: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम्

verse_translation.google_trans: For the mind is restless, O Krishna, and strongly strong. I think it is very difficult to restrain him from the wind
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed one, the mind is uncontrolled and moving. but by practice, O Kaunteya, and by renunciation, is taken

verse_data: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः

verse_translation.google_trans: I think that yoga is difficult to attain by the uncontrolled soul But by the subdued soul, the means can be attained by the means of attaining it.
Arjuna said

verse_data: अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति

verse_translation.google_trans: Ayati is faithful and moved by yoga. Without attaining the perfection of yoga, what is the path of Krishna.
I hope the clouds are destroyed, as if they were cut off like a cloud. Unrestrained, mighty-armed, confused on the path of Brahman.
This is my doubt, O Krishna, you should cut it off in detail There is no one who cuts off this doubt other than you
Sri Bhagavanvacha
O Partha, there is no destruction of the Namutra here. For no one who does good, my father, goes to misfortune
Having attained the world of merits, they live for eternal equality. In the house of the cleansed, the yoga is absorbed in yoga.

verse_data: अथ वा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Or maybe it is in the family of the yogis of the wise This is the rarest birth in the world which is such

verse_data: यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन

verse_translation.google_trans: There he gets that intellectual union with the pre-body. and strives then again in perfection, O son of the Kurus
By previous practice he is taken away by the same, even if he is not. Even the inquisitive transcends the word Brahma of yoga
The yogi who is self-controlled by effort is purified of sins In many births, he goes to the next destination.
A yogi is greater than the ascetics and is greater than the wise The yogi is greater than the karmas, therefore be the yogi, O Arjuna.

verse_data: श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः

verse_translation.google_trans: Even for all the yogis, by the inner self in Me. He who worships Me with faith is considered by Me to be the most righteous
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु

verse_translation.google_trans: My mind is attached to Me, O Partha, and engages in yoga. Listen to me as you will undoubtedly know Me in the whole
I will tell you this with knowledge in detail Knowing that there is nothing else to be known here again
Someone strives for perfection in thousands of human beings Even those who strive to know me in fact

verse_data: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च

verse_translation.google_trans: The earth, water, fire, air, sky, mind and intelligence Ego is the eightfold nature of my nature.
Know Me as the other nature of the other, the other nature. The living beings, O mighty-armed one, who holds this world.
Understand that these are all beings. I am the origin and dissolution of the whole world

verse_data: मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव

verse_translation.google_trans: There is nothing beyond me, Dhananjaya All this is stretched in me like a gem in the thread

verse_data: प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु

verse_translation.google_trans: I am the taste in the waters, O Kaunteya, in the light of the moon and the sun. Pranava in all the Vedas sound in the sky and manhood in men

verse_data: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ

verse_translation.google_trans: I am the holy fragrance of the earth and the light in the fire I am life in all beings and austerity in the ascetics

verse_data: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Know me to be the seed of all beings, O Partha, the eternal. I am the intellect of the wise, and I am the splendor of the effulgent.
I am the strength of the strong and devoid of lust and passion. I am the desire of beings contrary to religion, O Bharata, O best of men.

verse_data: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये
मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि

verse_translation.google_trans: Ye chaiva sattvika bhava rajasa tamasa ye Know them to be from Me, but I am not in them, they are in me.
By these three modes of nature, all this is the world. Deluded does not recognize me, the supreme inexhaustible.

verse_data: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया
मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते

verse_translation.google_trans: This is the divine virtue of my illusion insurmountable Those who take refuge in Me alone cross over this illusion

verse_data: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः

verse_translation.google_trans: The foolish, the fools, do not seek Me, the lowest of men. They relied on the demoniac nature of the knowledge taken away by illusion
Four kinds of people worship Me, O Arjuna, of good deeds. Arto, inquisitive, seeking wealth and wise, O Bharata

verse_data: प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः

verse_translation.google_trans: Their wise and ever-contained monotheistic devotion is superior For I am very dear to the wise and he is dear to me

verse_data: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम्
आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: All these are generous, and I think that the wise is the self. For he who has established himself in a steady spirit is the best destination
At the end of many births, the wise attains Me. Vasudeva is everything, that great soul is very rare

verse_data: तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया

verse_translation.google_trans: The other gods attain to the knowledge taken away by those lustful desires They are self-controlled by nature, following that law.

verse_data: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति

verse_translation.google_trans: The devotee who desires to worship with faith in whatever body he is I put that same unshakable faith in him

verse_data: लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान्

verse_translation.google_trans: He is endowed with that faith and strives for her raising her and then he gets his desires, for they are prescribed by Me.
The end of their end is that they will be of little intelligence. My devotees go to the gods and the gods and go to Me too
The intellectuals think of Me as an unmanifest personality My inexhaustible and excellent without knowing the Supreme Being
I am not the light of all, enveloped in the Yoga-Maya This foolish world does not know me, the unborn, the inexhaustible.

verse_data: भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन

verse_translation.google_trans: Vedaham samatitani vartamanni Charjun And no one knows the future and the beings.
By the delusion of duality arising from desire and hatred, India All beings go in the creation of delusion.
Those who have sinned in the end of the pious deeds of men They are freed from the delusion of duality and worship Me with firm vows

verse_data: ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Those who strive for the liberation of old age and death They know that Brahman is the whole, the spiritual and the whole action.

verse_data: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः

verse_translation.google_trans: Those who know Me as the Adhidaiva of the Sadhibhuta and the Sadhiyajna And even at the time of departure, they know Me with steady minds.
Arjuna said

verse_data: किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम

verse_translation.google_trans: What is that Brahman, what is the spiritual, what is action, O Purushottama And what is the supernatural and what is said to be the supernatural?
How is the Adhiyajna here in this body, Madhusoodana And at the time of departure, how can you be known by the self-controlled.
Sri Bhagavanvacha
The imperishable Brahman is the supreme nature called the Adhyatma The discharge of the being-being is called karma.
The supernatural, the perishable, the being, the man, the super-deity. I am the Adhiyajna here in the body, the best of the embodied.

verse_data: यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः

verse_translation.google_trans: And at the end of time, remembering me alone, the body is released. He who goes away goes to My being, there is no doubt about it.

verse_data: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Whoever remembers or remembers the emotions at the end of the body That is what it is, O Kaunteya, always being absorbed in it.
Therefore remember me at all times and fight You will undoubtedly come to Me, the mind and intellect dedicated to Me.
By the practice of practice yoga and not by any other goal He goes to the divine Supreme Person, thinking of Partha
The poet, the Puranas, the discipline; The inconceivable form of all the metal;

verse_data: प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेन; भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव
भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्य;क्स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम्

verse_translation.google_trans: by the mind-walker at the time of departure;with devotion and by the power of yoga In placing the life-force in the middle of the eyebrows, the divine man attains that Supreme Person.

verse_data: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति; विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः
यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति; तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये

verse_translation.google_trans: The letter which the Vedic scholars say;They enter the yatayo veetaragas Whatever they desire, they practice celibacy;I shall explain the term in collection

verse_data: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च

verse_translation.google_trans: Restraining all the gates and restrain the mind in the heart He placed the life-force on his head and remained in yoga.

verse_data: यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Om is the one-letter Brahman, remembering Me, and remembering Me He who goes away leaving the body goes to the supreme destination

verse_data: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः

verse_translation.google_trans: He who always remembers me with exclusive mind I am easy for him, O Partha, for the ever-contained yogi
Reincarnate and rebirth the eternal abode of suffering The great souls do not attain the supreme perfection

verse_data: मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: A Brahmabhuvanalalokas are repeated, O Arjuna. But after reaching Me, O Kaunteya, there is no rebirth.
They know the great Brahman for a thousand ages The night is the end of a thousand ages, and the people who know the day and night
All the individuals from the unmanifest arise in the coming of the day They dissolve at the arrival of night in the same unmanifest.

verse_data: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते

verse_translation.google_trans: The Bhutagram is the same and dissolves as being. In the coming of the night, O Partha, it arises in the coming of the day.

verse_data: यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: Beyond that, however, the being is another unmanifest, eternal from the unmanifest. He who is not destroyed in all beings who are destroyed

verse_data: यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम

verse_translation.google_trans: The unmanifest is called the akshara, and that is called the supreme destination That is my supreme abode, which they do not return after attaining

verse_data: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया

verse_translation.google_trans: That Supreme Being, O Arjuna, is attainable by devotion without exclusion Whose beings are within whom all this is pervaded

verse_data: प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ

verse_translation.google_trans: where the yogis have not returned and return I will tell you that time, O best of the Bharatas.

verse_data: तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः

verse_translation.google_trans: Fire, light, Raha, Shukla, six months, Uttarayana The Brahmans who know the Brahman go there go there
Smoke is the night and the black six months are the southern moon There the lunar light attains the light of the yogi

verse_data: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते

verse_translation.google_trans: These are the movements of the white and black, according to the eternal world. One goes to the non-return and the other returns again

verse_data: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन

verse_translation.google_trans: No one is deluded by knowing these creations, O Partha. Therefore, at all times, become yogic, O Arjuna

verse_data: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव; दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम्
अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा; योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम्

verse_translation.google_trans: in the Vedas, sacrifices, and austerities;The pious fruits given in charity He crosses all that, knowing this;The yogi attains the supreme place and the original
Sri Bhagavanvacha
I shall tell you this most secret of the unenvious Knowledge with knowledge which you will be freed from evil from evil
Rajavidya Rajaguhyam Pavitramidam Uttamam Directly understanding the righteous and the inexhaustible
The unbelief men are the parantapas of this religion Without attaining Me, they turn away from the world of death.
I have spread this whole world in the unmanifest form of the universe All beings are in Me and I am not present in them

verse_data: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Nor do you see the beings in Me, the Lord of Yoga. My soul is the creator of beings and not bearing beings
As the sky is always in the sky, the great everywhere is great. and understand that all beings are in Me.
All beings, O Kaunteya, go to my nature. I release them again at the beginning of the Kalpa at the end of the Kalpa
I hold my nature and release it again and again This whole group of beings is under the control of nature

verse_data: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनंजय

verse_translation.google_trans: Nor do those actions bind me, Dhananjaya Indifferent as if indifferent and unattached in those actions
By me, nature gives birth to the moving and non-moving. By reason, O Kaunteya, the universe is reversed
Fools despise me, dependent on a human body. Knowing the Supreme Being, the Lord of all beings,
Moghashas are in vain-knowledge, in vain knowledge is unconscious. They were lying on the bewitching nature of the demonesses and the demoniac nature
The great souls, O Arjuna, have taken refuge in the divine nature of Me. They worship the infinitely mindful, knowing the infinite beings.
They constantly chanted Me and try to keep their vows And bowing down, they worship Me with devotion, ever steadfast.
Others worship Me while performing sacrifices by the sacrifice of knowledge In unity, separately, the multiple omnipresent
I am the sacrifice, I am the sacrifice, I am the sacrifice, I am the medicine. I am the mantra, I am the sacrifice, I am the fire, I am the sacrifice.
My father is the mother of the world, the creator, the grandfather. The altar, the sacred omkara, the Riksam and the Yajurveda.

verse_data: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत्

verse_translation.google_trans: The path is the husband, the Lord is the witness, the dwelling, the refuge, the friend. The origin, the dissolution, the place, the treasure, the seed, the inexhaustible
I am heat, I am restraining the rain and I release it. I am immortal and death, Sadasa and I am, O Arjuna.

verse_data: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा; यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते

verse_translation.google_trans: Trividya me Somapah Putapapa;They worship the heavens and pray for heaven They attain the holy world of the gods;

verse_data: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं; क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति

verse_translation.google_trans: They enjoyed it, the heavenly world;They enter the mortal world when they are depleted Thus the Trinity Dharma is attained;They get the past and the future.
Those who worship Me thinking of others I carry the safety of those who are ever engaged in yoga
Those who are devoted to other gods and who worship with faith They too, O Kaunteya, worship Me in accordance with the law

verse_data: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च

verse_translation.google_trans: For I am the enjoyer and the Lord of all sacrifices But they do not know Me in fact, and therefore they are destroyed.

verse_data: भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम्

verse_translation.google_trans: They go to Devavrata, the gods, the ancestors, the vows of the fathers. Ghosts go to the ghosts and go to me, even if they go.

verse_data: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति

verse_translation.google_trans: He who offers me leaves, flowers, fruits and water with devotion That I eat with devotion I eat the self-controlled soul
Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you give, whatever you give, whatever you give. Whatever austerities you do, O Kaunteya, do it for me.
You will be freed from the bonds of action in this way with good and evil fruits You will come to Me, freed from the mind of renunciation.

verse_data: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः
ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I am equal to all beings and I have no hater nor dear But those who worship Me with devotion are in Me and I am in them

verse_data: साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः

verse_translation.google_trans: Even if the wicked worships me exclusively He should be considered a saint, for he is rightly decided.

verse_data: कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति

verse_translation.google_trans: The righteous quickly attains eternal peace O Kaunteya, promise me that My devotee is not destroyed

verse_data: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः
स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: For, O Arjuna, whoever takes refuge in Me, will be born of sinful deeds Women, Vaishyas and Sudras also attain the supreme destination
What about the pious devotees of the Brahmins and the royal sages Having attained this eternal unhappy world, worship Me

verse_data: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु

verse_translation.google_trans: Be my mind, my devotee, I salute me, my devotee. You will come to Me, and thus you will be devoted to Me.
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः

verse_translation.google_trans: Again, O mighty-armed one, hear my supreme words. I will tell you what I will tell you for your welfare

verse_data: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः

verse_translation.google_trans: The gods do not know my origin nor the great sages For I am the beginning of the gods and the great sages in all directions
He who knows Me and the beginning of the world, the Lord of the worlds. He is unconfused and is freed from all sins in mortals

verse_data: सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च

verse_translation.google_trans: Intelligence, knowledge, non-delusion, forgiveness, truth, restraint, and peace Happiness, pain, being, absence, fear and fearlessness

verse_data: भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः

verse_translation.google_trans: Non-violence, equality, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame and dishonor The emotions of beings are different from Me.

verse_data: मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः

verse_translation.google_trans: The seven great sages in the east and the four Manus My emotions are born of the mind whose world are these people

verse_data: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः

verse_translation.google_trans: He who knows this glory and yoga of mine in truth He is engaged in unshakable yoga, there is no doubt about it

verse_data: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः

verse_translation.google_trans: I am the source of all things and everything is initiated from me Considering this, the wise worship Me with emotions.

verse_data: कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च

verse_translation.google_trans: My minds, my minds, enlighten each other. They are always satisfied and enjoyed while telling me

verse_data: ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते

verse_translation.google_trans: They are constantly engaged in worshiping them with love I give you the Yoga of intelligence by which they come to me
I am the darkness born of ignorance for their own compassion I destroy the self-consciousness of knowledge by the lamp of knowledge
Arjuna said

verse_data: परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान्

verse_translation.google_trans: The Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Abode, the Holy One, the Supreme Being. Purusha, eternal, divine, original God, unborn and almighty

verse_data: असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे

verse_translation.google_trans: All the sages, Devarshis and Naradas said to you Asita Devala Vyasa and you yourself are telling me

verse_data: न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः

verse_translation.google_trans: I think all this is true that you tell me, Keshav For neither the gods nor the demons know the manifestation of the Lord.
You know yourself yourself, O Purushottama Bhootbhavana Bhootesh Devadeva Jagatpate
You should tell me the rest of the divine self-glories By the glory of which you pervade these worlds

verse_data: केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया

verse_translation.google_trans: How can I know the yogi, always thinking of you. In what and in what emotions you are to be thought of, O Lord.

verse_data: भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम्

verse_translation.google_trans: In detail, the yoga and the glory of the self, O Janardana. Tell me again, for I have no nectar while listening to me.
Sri Bhagavanvacha
Well, I will tell you the divine self-glories. O best of the Kurus there is no end to my detail

verse_data: अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च

verse_translation.google_trans: I am the Self, Gudakesha, in the hearts of all beings. I am the beginning and the middle and the end of all beings
I am Vishnu among the suns and the sun of the lights. I am Marichi, the Maruts, and I am the moon among the stars
I am the Samaveda among the Vedas and I am Vasava among the gods I am the mind of the senses and I am the consciousness of beings
I am Lord Shiva among the Rudras and the lord of wealth among the yakshas and rakshasas I am the fire of the Vasus, and I am the Meru of the peaks.

verse_data: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: And know Me as the chief among the priests, O Partha, Brihaspati. I am Skanda of the armies, and I am the ocean of the lakes.
I am Bhrigu, the one letter of the great sages. I am the chanting of sacrifices, the Himalayas of the movable.
Ashvattha is the Narada of all the trees and the gods and sages Chitraratha among the Gandharvas, the sage Kapila among the Siddhas.
Know me to be the source of nectar for the horses of high-hearted horses Airavata, the king of elephants and men.
I am the thunderbolt of the weapons, and I am the milk of the cow. I am the progeny of Cupid and I am Vasuki among the serpents
I am infinite and Varuna among the serpents, and I am the Yadasa. I am Aryama of the ancestors and Yama is the controller of restraint
I am Prahlada and I am the time of the giants of the calculators I am the deer among the deer and the Vainateya among the birds
I am the wind among the winds, and I am Rama among the weapons. I am the crocodile among the fish, and I am the source of the sources.
I am the beginning and the end of the creations, O Arjuna. I am the argument of spiritual knowledge and the argument of knowledge
I am the letter of the letters and the duality of the compound I am the inexhaustible time, the creator, I am all-facing.

verse_data: कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा

verse_translation.google_trans: I am death and all-destroying and the origin of the future Fame, beauty, speech, memory, intelligence, patience, forgiveness.
The Brihatsama and the Samanam Gayatri are the verses. I am the Margashirsa of the months, the flowering of the dead.
I am the effulgence of the gambling of the gamblers. I am victory, I am business, I am the Sattva of the Sattvas.
I am Vasudeva among the Vrishnis, Dhananjaya among the Pandavas Among the sages I am Vyasa and the poet of the poet Mushana
I am the punishment of the self-control, and I am the policy of the conquerors. I am silence for the secrets, and I am the knowledge of the wise.

verse_data: न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्

verse_translation.google_trans: And whatever is the seed of all beings, O Arjuna There is nothing without what I have past, moving and non-moving.
There is no end to my divine glories, O Parantapa This is the detail of the glory I have mentioned from the purpose
Whatever glorious being is rich or powerful That is what you have to understand my splendour.

verse_data: अथ वा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन

verse_translation.google_trans: Or what about this much by this, O Arjuna, what you know. I am dwelling in this whole world with one part of the universe
Arjuna said
For My grace, the supreme secret is called Adhyatma. This delusion of my delusion has been lost by the words you have said

verse_data: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया

verse_translation.google_trans: I have heard in detail about the beings and the destruction of beings From you, O lotus-eyed one, the greatness is also inexhaustible.
Thus it is as you say, O God. I wish to see your form, O Purushottama.

verse_data: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो

verse_translation.google_trans: If you think that I can see it, Lord O Lord of Yoga, then show me the inexhaustible Self.
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः

verse_translation.google_trans: Look at my forms, O Partha, hundreds and then thousands Various kinds of divine and various colors and shapes
See the suns, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Aśvinīs, the Maruts and the Maruts. Look at many other things I have never seen, O India
See the whole world in one place here, moving and non-moving. Gudakesha in my body and whatever else you want to see

verse_data: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा
दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्

verse_translation.google_trans: But you cannot see me with your own eyes I give you divine eyes, see my divine yoga.
Sanjaya said
Having said this, then, O King, Hari, the lord of the great yogas, He showed Partha the supreme form of God
Many-faced eyes, many amazing sights. Many divine ornaments are divine and many-rich weapons
Wearing divine garlands and garments of divine perfume ointment All wonders and infinitely omnipresent God

verse_data: यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः

verse_translation.google_trans: In heaven, a thousand suns will be simultaneously. If the light is similar to the light of that great soul
There is one in the whole world, divided into many parts. Then Pandavas saw the body of the gods in the body of the gods
Then he was astonished and cheerful and his hair was Dhananjaya He bowed his head to the god and spoke with folded hands
Arjuna said

verse_data: पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे; सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसंघान्

verse_translation.google_trans: I see the gods in your body;All the groups of beings and special groups Brahma, the Lord, seated on the lotus; the sages and all the divine beings.

verse_data: नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं; पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप

verse_translation.google_trans: many arms, stomachs, mouths and eyes;I see you in infinite form everywhere There is no end, no middle, no again;I see Visvesvara Visvaroop

verse_data: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च; तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The crown and the throat and the wheel;Tejorashim shining everywhere I see you invisible, all around;

verse_data: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं; त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्
त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता; सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे

verse_translation.google_trans: You should be known as the infinitesimal;You are the supreme treasure of this world You are inexhaustible, the protector of eternal religion;You are the eternal Purusha, I think

verse_data: पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं; स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Eternal, middle and infinitely powerful; I see you with the face of a blazing fire;This world is heating with his own effulgence

verse_data: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि; व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः
दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमिदं तवोग्रं; लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन्

verse_translation.google_trans: This is the difference between the heavens and the earth;You have covered all directions by one alone Seeing this wonderful form of yours;The three worlds are disturbed, O great soul.

verse_data: अमी हि त्वा सुरसंघा विशन्ति; केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति
स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसंघाः; स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः

verse_translation.google_trans: These are the hosts of the gods enter you;Some are afraid and bow down They say that it is Swasti, the Maharshi Siddhas;They praise you with many praises

verse_data: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या; विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च

verse_translation.google_trans: Rudra, Aditya, Vasava and those who are Sadhya;Visve, Ashvin, Maruta and Choshmapas Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras and Siddhas;All of you look at you and are amazed
Form is a great multi-faced eye;Mahabaho Bahubahurupadam Bahudaram bahudanshtrakaralaam;I saw the people in distress

verse_data: दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा; धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो

verse_translation.google_trans: The sky-touching, glowing, and many-coloured;Vyattananam glowing and large eyes For seeing you, the inner self is disturbed;I find patience and peace and Vishnu

verse_data: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि; दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसंनिभानि
दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म; प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास

verse_translation.google_trans: and their faces are terrible with fangs;Seeing the fire of time I don't know the directions and I get shame;Prasid Devesh Jagannivas

verse_data: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः; सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसंघैः

verse_translation.google_trans: And these are the sons of Dhritarashtra;All together with the guardians of the earth Bhishma, Drona, Suta, and so on;with us and the chiefs of the warriors

verse_data: वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति; दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि

verse_translation.google_trans: They enter the mouths of the mouth;The fangs were terrible and terrible Some are separated from the teeth;They appear to be crushed by the best limbs
as many rivers of rivers;The sea itself is facing downwards and Tavami, the hero of the world;They enter the faces and they are bright

verse_data: यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतंगा; विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः
तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोका;स्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः

verse_translation.google_trans: as a lit flame is a moth;They enter the rich speed for destruction Similarly, the worlds enter for destruction; your faces are rich-speed
Lelihyse swallowing all around; fills the whole of the universe with their lights;Bhasastavagrah pratapanti Vishnu

verse_data: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो; नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद
विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं; न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Tell me who you are fierce;Namastu te Devavar Prasid I want to know you, the original;I do not know your instinct
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: ऋतेऽपि त्वा न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे; येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः

verse_translation.google_trans: I am time, the destroyer of the world;Initiated here to gather the worlds There will be no all except you;The warriors who are situated in the counter-errs

verse_data: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व; जित्वा शत्रून्भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम्
मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव; निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्

verse_translation.google_trans: Therefore, get up and get fame;Defeat your enemies and enjoy the kingdom. I have already killed these;Be the cause only, Savyasachin

verse_data: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च; कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान्
मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा; युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान्

verse_translation.google_trans: Drona and Bhishma and Jayadratha;Karna and other warriors Kill those who have been killed, and do not be distressed;Fight, you conquer your enemies in battle.
Sanjaya said

verse_data: नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं; सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य

verse_translation.google_trans: Hearing this, the words of Keshav;Kritjali Venah Kiriti Bowing and again I said to Krishna;Sagadgadam bhitabhita pranamamya
Arjuna said

verse_data: स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या; जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च
रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति; सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसंघाः

verse_translation.google_trans: in place, Hrishikesh, by your fame;The world rejoices and is attracted The demons fled in all directions;Everyone bows down to the Siddhas

verse_data: अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास; त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्

verse_translation.google_trans: And why do they not bow down to the great soul; Infinite Devesh Jagannanivas;You are the imperishable, the good and the ultimate.

verse_data: त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराण;स्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्
वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम; त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप

verse_translation.google_trans: You are the original God, the Purusha, the Purana;You are the supreme treasure of this universe. You are the knowable and the knowable and the supreme abode;The universe is spread by you and infinite form

verse_data: नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः; पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते

verse_translation.google_trans: The wind, the Yama, the fire, the Varuna, the moon;You are the Creator and the great-grandfather Obeisance to you, O thousand times;Again and again, I offer my obeisances to you

verse_data: नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते; नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व

verse_translation.google_trans: Obeisance to the front and from the back;Obeisance to you everywhere You are infinitely powerful and immeasurably powerful;You are all-pervading and then you are all

verse_data: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं; हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति
अजानता महिमानं तवेदं; मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि

verse_translation.google_trans: That which is said to be a friend and forcibly;O Krishna O Yadava O Sakheti Your glory is not known;I have negligently or with love
And whatever you are disrespected for the sake of ridicule;in vihara, beds, seats and meals One or even the infallible in front of it;I am forgiven you, I am immeasurable.

verse_data: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य; त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान्

verse_translation.google_trans: You are the father of the world of moving and non-moving;You are his worshipable teachers and great men There is none equal to you, what is there to be greater than you;The influence of the three worlds

verse_data: पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः; प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Therefore, he bows down and meditates on the body;I appease you, I am the Lord of the universe. The father's friend is like a friend;Dear dear, you deserve to bear the God.

verse_data: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा; भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे
तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपं; प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास

verse_translation.google_trans: I am delighted to see the unseen before;And my mind is agitated by fear That is what I have shown to me, O God;Prasid Devesh Jagannivas

verse_data: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्त;मिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव
तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन; सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते

verse_translation.google_trans: I want to see you as the crown of the crown of the wheel; in that same form with four arms;Sahasrabaho be Visvamurte
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं; रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात्
तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं; यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम्

verse_translation.google_trans: I have pleased you, O Arjuna;The form beyond the self-yoga is shown The effulgent universe is the beginning of the infinite;which I have never seen before you

verse_data: न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानै;र्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः
एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके; द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर

verse_translation.google_trans: Not by the study of the Vedas and sacrifices, not by charity; Such a form is possible in the world of men;To see you by others, O hero of the Kurus

verse_data: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो; दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम्
व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं; तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य

verse_translation.google_trans: Do not be afflicted and not bewildered;Seeing this terrible form of mine You are again pleased and happy again;That’s what I see this form of mine
Sanjaya said

verse_data: इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा; स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः
आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं; भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा

verse_translation.google_trans: Having said so, Vasudeva said;He showed his form again and consoled him in fear;Becoming again, the gentle form of the great soul
Arjuna said

verse_data: दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन

verse_translation.google_trans: Seeing this human form your gentle Janardana Now I am turned away and the conscious has gone to nature
Sri Bhagavanvacha
You have seen this form of a very difficult sight Even the gods are always seeking sight of this form

verse_data: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया
शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा

verse_translation.google_trans: I am not by the Vedas, nor by austerities, nor by charity, nor by Chejya. It is possible to see such a thing as you have seen me
