verse_data: ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परंतप

verse_translation.google_trans: But I am able to do so with devotion, O Arjuna. To know and to see and to enter into the truth, O Parantapa

verse_data: निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव

verse_translation.google_trans: My working is the supreme devotee of Me and devoid of attachment He who is free from enmity, O Pandava, is Me.
Arjuna said
Thus constantly engaged, those devotees who worship you Who are the best of those who are also unmanifest and unmanifest
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते

verse_translation.google_trans: Those who worship Me with ever engaged in Me, fixing in Me They are the most righteous of Me with faith in faith
Those who worship the imperishable, the indefinable, the unmanifest The omnipresent and inconceivable and the unchanging pole
Controlling the sense-grammas, they are equally minded everywhere. They get me, devoted to the welfare of all beings.
The trouble is greater than their unmanifest and attached minds For the unmanifested path is attained by the bodies of suffering.

verse_data: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः

verse_translation.google_trans: But those who renounce all actions in Me and are devoted to Me They worship Me by meditating on Me without any other yoga
I am their savior from the ocean of death and the world I shall soon become, O Arjuna, for those whose minds are fixed in Me.

verse_data: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय
निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः

verse_translation.google_trans: Fix your mind in Me and put your intelligence in Me You will live in me, no doubt.

verse_data: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Then you cannot fix your mind steady in me By the combination of practice then, O Arjuna, I wish to attain me.
You are incapable even in practice and be devoted to My actions You will attain perfection by doing actions even for me
Then you are unable to do this, relying on My Yoga. Then renounce the fruits of all actions and then controlled the self
For knowledge is better than practice, and meditation is better than knowledge From meditation, the renunciation of the fruits of action, and after renunciation, peace

verse_data: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च

verse_translation.google_trans: He is not hated and is friendly and compassionate to all beings He is free from attachment, egoism, equal pain and pleasure, forgiving.
Satisfied, always the yogi, self-controlled, firmly determined. He who has devoted his mind and intellect to Me is dear to Me.

verse_data: हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः

verse_translation.google_trans: From whom the world does not fear and who is not afraid of the world He who is free from joy, anger, fear and anxiety is dear to Me

verse_data: सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः

verse_translation.google_trans: Indifferent, pure, skilled, indifferent, free from pain. He who renounces all beginnings and is My devotee is dear to Me

verse_data: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति

verse_translation.google_trans: He who neither rejoices nor hates nor grieves nor desires He who renounces good and evil and is devoted to Me is dear to Me

verse_data: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानावमानयोः

verse_translation.google_trans: Equal to enemies and friends and in honor and dishonour Equal in cold and heat, pleasure and pain, devoid of association
Equal condemnation, praise, silence, satisfied with whatever Aniketa steady-minded, devoted to me, my dear man.
But those who worship this righteous nectar as stated above They are faithful and devoted to Me and are very dear to Me
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः

verse_translation.google_trans: This body is called Kaunteya Kshetra He who knows this is called the knower of the field.

verse_data: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत

verse_translation.google_trans: Know Me to be the knower of the field in all the fields, India I think that knowledge of the field and the field-knowing is that knowledge

verse_data: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत्
स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु

verse_translation.google_trans: That field, whatever it is, whatever it is transformed and what it is. Hear from me in brief what he is and what his powers
The sages have sung in many ways separately by various verses and by the words of the Brahma Sutra and the Hetumads.
The great beings are ego, intelligence and unmanifest The senses are ten and five and the five senses are visible to the senses

verse_data: इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः

verse_translation.google_trans: Desire, hatred, pleasure, pain, conflict, consciousness, patience This field is summarized in summary
Unmanifestness, arrogance, non-violence, forbearance and simplicity. Worship of the teacher, purity, stability and self-control
and renunciation of sense objects and non-egoism Birth, death, old age, disease, suffering and evil resemblance.
Unattachedness without embracing sons, wives, houses, etc. and always in the assertions of the desired and the undesirable.
Devotion by exclusive yoga is infallible Viviktadeshasevitvamrati janasansadi
Spiritual knowledge eternity is the vision of the meaning of knowledge of the truth This is knowledge, which is said to be knowledge, and whatever else is otherwise.
I will tell you what is to be known and what you know and eats nectar The eternal Brahman is not called Sattva and Nasa.
The hands and feet are everywhere, that is the face of the eyes, the head and the face. Everywhere in the world of hearing remains covering everything
The illusion of all the senses is devoid of all senses Unattached to all and the enjoyer of the modes of nature.
and external and internal and immovable and immovable Because of its subtlety, it is unknowable, and it is far away.

verse_data: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम्
भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च

verse_translation.google_trans: undivided and established as divided among beings Bhutabhartri cha tajjnyeyam devāgīśnu prabhavishṇu cha

verse_data: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Even among the lights, that light is beyond the darkness. Knowledge is the knowable, the knowledgeable, the heart of everything.

verse_data: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः

verse_translation.google_trans: This is the field and the knowledge and the knowable in summary My devotee, knowing this, approaches My being.
Know nature and the man, and both the others Know the transformations and the qualities of nature.
The cause of the cause and effect is called nature. The man is said to be the enjoyer of pleasures and pains
For a man in nature enjoys the qualities born of nature The cause of the association of the modes of nature is in the births of the good and evil.
The Lord is the enjoyer and the enjoyer and the enjoyer. The Supreme Person is also called the Supreme Self in this body.

verse_data: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह

verse_translation.google_trans: He who thus knows the Purusha and Nature with the virtues In any case, even if he is present, he is not born again
Some see themselves in themselves by meditation on themselves Others by Sankhya Yoga and others by Karma Yoga
Others worship others without knowing it They too transcend death and are devoted to hearing
As long as there is any being, movable and immovable. Know that from the combination of the field and the field-knowing, O Bharatarshabha
God, who stands equal in all beings, He who sees the perishable and the self-destroying sees

verse_data: न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Seeing the same God everywhere equally He does not kill himself and then goes to the next destination
and by nature the actions are performed in all respects He who sees the Self as such sees the doer

verse_data: तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म संपद्यते तदा

verse_translation.google_trans: When he sees the separateness of beings in one place From that very expansion the Brahman is attained then

verse_data: शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: Because it is eternal and devoid of quality, the Supreme Self is inexhaustible Even in the body, O Kaunteya, he does not do or tainted
as the omnipresent subtlety is not covered with the sky The soul is not tainted in the body everywhere.

verse_data: क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत

verse_translation.google_trans: As one reveals this whole world, the sun The field is the field and illuminates the whole of India

verse_data: भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The difference between the field and the field-knowing is the eye of knowledge Those who know the liberation of the past and the nature of the past
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः

verse_translation.google_trans: But I will tell you again the best knowledge of knowledge Knowing that all the sages have gone to the supreme perfection.

verse_data: सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च

verse_translation.google_trans: Resorting to this knowledge, they have come to be equal to Me. They are not born even in creation and they are not disturbed in annihilation
My womb is the great Brahman, and I place the pregnancy in it. The possibility of all beings then becomes India
O Kaunteya idols which are possible in all wombs They are the Brahma, the great vagina, the seed-giving father.
The qualities of Sattva, Rajas and Tamas are the possibilities of nature They bind, O mighty-armed one, in the body, the inexhaustible embodied in the body.
There, the Sattva is the illuminator because of its immaculateness. He binds by the association of happiness and by the association of knowledge and sin
Know that Rajas are passionate about the attachment of thirst That binds the embodied by the association of action, O Kaunteya.
Know that darkness is the cause of ignorance of all embodied beings He negligates with negligence and sleep, India

verse_data: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत

verse_translation.google_trans: Sattva conquers the mode of goodness in action, India. But darkness covers knowledge, but in negligence.

verse_data: रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा

verse_translation.google_trans: Rajas and Tamas are overwhelmed by Sattva, India Rajas, Sattva, Tamas, Tamas, Sattva and Rajas
In all the gates, light is produced in this body When knowledge is there, it is known as the enlarged Sattva.
Greed, instinct, initiation, uncontrolled desire for actions These are born of Rajas, O best of the Bharatas.
He is not illuminating and involving negligence and delusion These are born of darkness in the growth, O son of the Kurus

verse_data: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत्

verse_translation.google_trans: When the body-bearer goes to the destruction when it is enlarged in Sattva Then he attains the immaculate worlds of the best knowers
He goes to annihilation in Rajas and is born in karma. and it is born in the fools merged in darkness.
They say that the Sattvic fruit of the good deeds of action is the fruit of the action The fruit of Rajas is suffering, ignorance is the fruit of darkness.

verse_data: सत्त्वात्संजायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च

verse_translation.google_trans: Knowledge is born of Sattva and greed for Rajas Heedless and delusion are the darkness of yours and your ignorance

verse_data: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः

verse_translation.google_trans: They go upwards and the Sattvas stand in the middle of the Rajas The Tamasics go down to the inferior quality circle.
When the seer sees no other than the modes And he who knows Me beyond the modes of nature attains Me.
The three-body-oriented body-origin He who is freed from birth, death, old age and suffering attains immortality
Arjuna said
The three qualities of the carlings are transcended by these, Lord. What is the practice and how does the chaitantrin qualities transcend
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव
न द्वेष्टि संप्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति

verse_translation.google_trans: Light and instinct and delusion, O Pandava He does not hate those who are involved nor desires those who are withdrawn
He who is not moved by virtues as if indifferent as if he were indifferent He who stands as the qualities are present
He is equally painful and pleasant, healthy, equal cluster of stones and gold Tulyapriyapriyao patience equal blasphemy self-praise
Equal to honor and dishonor, equal to friends and enemies. He who renounces all beginnings is called transcendental to the modes
And he who serves me with invariance with devotional yoga He transcends the modes and is able to become Brahman.
For I am the establishment of the Brahman and the inexhaustible immortal and of eternal religion and solitude
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित्

verse_translation.google_trans: The upper roots and lower branches are called the Ashvattha. He who knows the leaves of the verses is a Vedic scholar
The branches of it spread above and above;Gunapravrdhautapravalah and below the roots are followed;Karma-related human beings

verse_data: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते; नान्तो न चादिर्न च संप्रतिष्ठा

verse_translation.google_trans: The form is not so perceived here;There is no end, no beginning and no establishment Ashvatthama is a well-discovered root;

verse_data: ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं; यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः
तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये; यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी

verse_translation.google_trans: Then the step should be sought for it;in which they have gone and do not return again I worship that same first man;Because the instinct is spreading the ancient
Nirmanamoha jitsangadosha;Adhyatmanitya Vivritkamas Freed from duality, the fools go by the knowledge of pleasure and pain;

verse_data: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः
यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम

verse_translation.google_trans: The sun, moon or fire shines on that That is my supreme abode which they do not return after going
My part in the world of living beings is eternal. The mind attracts the sixth senses in nature
The body which he attains and whatever he leaves is God The wind goes together and takes them from the fragrance.

verse_data: श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च

verse_translation.google_trans: The ear, the eye, the touch, the taste, the sense of smell. The mind is overwhelmed by the subject.

verse_data: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम्

verse_translation.google_trans: Whether it is moving or standing or eating, it is endowed with virtues The bewilders do not see the eyes of knowledge
The yogis and the yogis see Him in the Self Even though they try to try, they do not see him in mind.
When the light in the sun illuminates the entire universe That which is in the moon and whatever is in the fire, know that it is mine.

verse_data: पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः

verse_translation.google_trans: I enter the village and hold the beings with my strength I nourish all the herbs and become the moon.
I am Vaisvanara and take refuge in the body of living beings I digest food with breathing and inhaling, four kinds of food.

verse_data: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि संनिविष्टो; मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च

verse_translation.google_trans: I am dwelling in the heart of everyone;From Me, memory, knowledge and absorption and by all the Vedas I am the Veda;Vedantakridvedavideva chaham

verse_data: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च

verse_translation.google_trans: These two men in the world are the akshara and the akshara The akshara is all beings, the Kutastha is called the Akshara.
The best man is said to be the Supreme Self. He who enters the three worlds and sustains the inexhaustible God

verse_data: अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः

verse_translation.google_trans: Because I am beyond the letter and the best of the letters That is why I am the best of men in the world and in the Vedas
He who knows Me as such, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. He worships Me all-knowing, O India, with all his heart
This is the most mysterious scripture, O sinless one. Knowing this, he will be wise and done, O India.
Sri Bhagavanvacha
Fearlessness is the purification of the Sattva, the arrangement of knowledge and yoga. Charity, restraint, sacrifice, study, austerity, arjavam
Non-violence, truthfulness, anger, renunciation, peacefulness. Compassion for beings, not greedy, gentleness, modesty, shyness.
Teja, forgiveness, patience, purity, betrayal, not exceedingly. They are the wealth of the divine abstract, India
Pride, arrogance, excessive anger and harshness Ignorance is the wealth of the unborn, O Partha, the wealth of the demon.
Divine wealth is considered to be a demon for the sake of essay Do not grieve, O Pandava, born of divine wealth.

verse_data: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च
दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु

verse_translation.google_trans: There are two creations in the world and the demon in this world Destiny, O son of Partha, have been described in detail.

verse_data: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः
न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: People do not know instinct and renunciation There is no purity, no chast, no truth in them.
They say that the world is untrue and unrealistic. What else is the cause of desire for the other.
They have lost their minds and have lost their minds with little intelligence They are the causes of the world for the destruction of the fierce deeds.
They were filled with pride and pride in relying on lust They are initiated out of delusion and initiate the unclean vows.
They relied on the immeasurable anxiety of annihilation They are certain that they are so far beyond the enjoyment of lust
bound by hundreds of hopes and devoted to lust and anger They strive for the sake of unjustly accumulations for the enjoyment of lust
This is what I have obtained today I will get this wish This is also mine and I will be my wealth again
I killed that enemy and I will kill others I am God, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, I am strong and happy.
I am rich and a relative who else like me They are deluded by ignorance that I will give it to the sacrifice
They are confused by many minds and enveloped in the network of delusion Attached to the pleasures of lust, they fall into the unclean hell.
They are self-realized, stunned, wealthy, and drunk. They sacrifice by the sacrifices of names, according to the law of pride.

verse_data: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः

verse_translation.google_trans: They rely on ego, strength, pride, lust and anger They are jealous of Me in the bodies of others and others.
I hate them, cruel and lowly in the world. I throw away the evils in the wombs of the demons
The fool who has attained the demoniac vagina in every birth Having not attained Me, O Kaunteya, then go to the lowest destination
There are three kinds of hell, this is the gate of destruction of the soul. Lust, anger and greed, therefore one should abandon these three
O Kaunteya, freed from these, the three gates of darkness are a man. He acts for the welfare of himself and then goes to the next destination

verse_data: न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम्

verse_translation.google_trans: He who lives in the work of desire, leaving the scriptural methods. He attains neither perfection nor happiness nor the supreme destination
Therefore, the scripture is the proof of your work and action. Knowing this, you should perform the action prescribed in the scriptures.
Arjuna said

verse_data: तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः

verse_translation.google_trans: Those who abandon the scriptural precepts with faithfulness What is their fixity, O Krishna, or Sattva, or Rajas and Tamas
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा
सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु

verse_translation.google_trans: There are three kinds of faith in the bodies, which are natural Hear that Sattvic, Rajasic and Tamasic.

verse_data: श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः

verse_translation.google_trans: The faith of everyone is in accordance with the essence, India This is the faithful man, and whatever faith is that he is that.
The Sattvikas, the gods, the akshas and the rakshasas, the Rajasics. Others worship the dead and the hosts of ghosts.

verse_data: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः

verse_translation.google_trans: Those who perform terrible austerities prescribed by the scriptures They are endowed with pride and ego and are strong in lust and passion
They dragged the body of the ghosts in the body. Know them to be in the inner body, and know them to be a demon.
Food, however, is also dear to everyone. Sacrifice, austerity and charity are the difference between them.

verse_data: रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः

verse_translation.google_trans: Age, Sattva, strength, health, happiness, pleasure and enhancement Flags, smooth, stable, hearts, foods, sattvic lovers.
bitter, sour, salty, hot, pungent, rough and burning. Foods are desired by the Rajasic, painful and lustful.

verse_data: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत्

verse_translation.google_trans: Yatayamam gatarasam puti paryushitam yath Even the leftover food is unclean and loves Tamas
The sacrifice which is sacrificed by those who desire fruitlessness is seen by the law Setting the mind that he should be sacrificed, he is Sattvic.

verse_data: अभिसंधाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत्
इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्

verse_translation.google_trans: but also for the sake of arrogance by abhisandhaya O best of the Bharatas, know that sacrifice as Rajasic.
Without rituals, uncreated food, without mantra, without alms. The sacrifice without faith is called Tamas
Worship of the gods, brahmins, teachers, wise men, purity and marble Celibacy and non-violence are called physical austerities

verse_data: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत्

verse_translation.google_trans: The words that are not anxiety are true and pleasant and good. The practice of self-study is also called valuable austerity
The grace of the mind is gentleness silence self-control This austerity is called the mental purity of emotions
Three kinds of austerities he performed with great faith by men They call it Sattvic with those who desire fruitlessness
That which is by austerity and pride for the sake of honor and worship That which is done here is said to be Rajasic, moving and immovable.
The penance which is performed by the torment of the self by foolish grasp or for the destruction of others, that is called Tamas

verse_data: देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The gift that is given to the unfortunate is to be given That gift in a place and time and in a vessel is considered to be Sattvic.

verse_data: दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम्

verse_translation.google_trans: That is, for the sake of reward or for the sake of the fruit again And it is given with difficulty, and that charity is remembered as Rajasic
The gifts given to the unworthy in an untimely time Disrespected and despised that is called Tamas
The direction of Om Tatsad is remembered as the threefold Brahman. The Brahmins were prescribed by him in the past
Therefore, the rituals of sacrifice, charity and austerity are called om. They are constantly mentioned by the laws of the Brahmavadians
The fruits of sacrifice and austerity are not to be resolved by that. and various rituals of charity are done by those who seek liberation

verse_data: प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: In the sense of goodness and in the sense of goodness, this is used as sad. In praiseworthy action, the word sach is used, O Partha,

verse_data: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: The position in sacrifice, austerity and charity is also called sadi Karma is also called Sadiya for that purpose

verse_data: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत्
असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह

verse_translation.google_trans: That which is offered, given, and performed by unbelief, and performed austerities. It is said to be non-existent, O Partha, and not here afterwards.
Arjuna said
I want to know the truth of renunciation, O mighty-armed one. and of renunciation, Hrishikesh, separate Keshinishudana
Sri Bhagavanvacha

verse_data: काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः

verse_translation.google_trans: The poets know the renunciation of the desirable actions. The wise say that renunciation is the renunciation of all the fruits of all actions
Some say that the action is to be abandoned as a fault Others say that sacrifice, charity and austerity should not be abandoned.

verse_data: निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम

verse_translation.google_trans: Definitely hear me there in renunciation, O best of Bharatas. For sacrifice is threefold, O tiger of men.
Sacrifice, charity, austerity and action are not to be abandoned, that is the work. Sacrifice, charity and austerity are the holy ones of the sages

verse_data: एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च

verse_translation.google_trans: But these are also actions and the fruits of abandoning association I have a certain opinion, O Partha, that they should be done.
But the renunciation of the fixed does not arise from the action From delusion his renunciation is described as Tamas

verse_data: स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत्

verse_translation.google_trans: Suffering is the action that should be abandoned for fear of bodily suffering He who does the Rajasic renunciation will not get the fruits of renunciation

verse_data: सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलं चैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः

verse_translation.google_trans: The action that is determined by the action is done, O Arjuna. That renunciation is considered to be Sattvic, abandoning association and fruit
He does not hate good deeds, nor does he follow a good man. The renunciant is incorporated into the intellect and the intelligence is cut off.

verse_data: न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः

verse_translation.google_trans: For it is not possible to give up actions in full But he who renounces the fruits of action is called a renunciant

verse_data: अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम्
भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित्

verse_translation.google_trans: There are three kinds of fruits of action, undesirable, desirable and mixed. It becomes the renunciants after death, not the renunciants anywhere
These five, O mighty-armed one, listen to me for reasons. For the perfection of all actions in the end of the Kṛta at the end of Sankhya

verse_data: अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम्

verse_translation.google_trans: The seat and the doer and the action are of separate types Various and separate movements and destiny are the fifth here

verse_data: न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः

verse_translation.google_trans: The action which the body begins with the body, speech and mind Right or contrary, these five are the causes of it

verse_data: तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः

verse_translation.google_trans: In such a case, the doer is the self alone, but the one who He sees, because he is not intelligent, he does not see, the wicked.

verse_data: यस्य नाहंकृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते
हत्वापि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते

verse_translation.google_trans: He who has no ego-created emotion, whose intelligence is not tainted Even if he kills, he does not kill these worlds, nor is he bound.
Knowledge is the knowable and the knower is of three kinds of action inducement There are three kinds of karma collection, namely, action, action and action.

verse_data: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः

verse_translation.google_trans: Knowledge, action and doer are threefold in the difference of qualities. It is said in the number of virtues as it is.
In all beings, by whom one sees the inexhaustible one. Know that knowledge of the undivided in the divided, as Sattvic.

verse_data: वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम्

verse_translation.google_trans: But by separately, knowledge which is separate from various beings. Know that knowledge in all beings, know that Rajas
That is, the whole of the great works attached to one work. And the little as the meaning of non-real meaning is called Tamas.
Determined, without attachment, without attachment and hatred. The action of the unfruitful is called the Sattvic.
